comment:
* Thrown to indicate that the application has attempted to convert
 * a string to one of the numeric types, but that the string does not
 * have the appropriate format.
 *
 * @see     java.lang.Integer#parseInt(String)
 * @since   1.0

methods.name: static NumberFormatException forInputString(String s, int radix)
methods.comment:
* Factory method for making a {@code NumberFormatException}
     * given the specified input which caused the error.
     *
     * @param   s   the input causing the error

methods.name: static NumberFormatException forCharSequence(CharSequence s, int beginIndex, int endIndex, int errorIndex)
methods.comment:
* Factory method for making a {@code NumberFormatException}
     * given the specified input which caused the error.
     *
     * @param   s   the input causing the error
     * @param   beginIndex   the beginning index, inclusive.
     * @param   endIndex     the ending index, exclusive.
     * @param   errorIndex   the index of the first error in s

methodNames: static NumberFormatException forInputString(String s, int radix)
static NumberFormatException forCharSequence(CharSequence s, int beginIndex, int endIndex, int errorIndex)
